AssociateAccessGroups.document: This API is used to bind multiple permission groups to a mount point.
AssociateAccessGroups.name: Binds permission group list

CreateAccessGroup.document: This API is used to create a permission group.
CreateAccessGroup.name: Creates permission group

CreateAccessRules.document: This API is used to batch create permission rules. You don't need to enter the permission rule IDs and creation time.
CreateAccessRules.name: Batch creates permission rules

CreateFileSystem.document: This API is used to create a file system (asynchronously).
CreateFileSystem.name: Creates file system

CreateLifeCycleRules.document: This API is used to batch create lifecycle rules. You don't need to enter the lifecycle rule IDs and creation time.
CreateLifeCycleRules.name: Batch creates lifecycle rules

CreateMountPoint.document: This API is used to create a mount point for a successfully created file system.
CreateMountPoint.name: Creates mount point

CreateRestoreTasks.document: This API is used to batch create restoration tasks. You don't need to enter the restoration task IDs, status, and creation time.
CreateRestoreTasks.name: Batch creates restoration tasks

DeleteAccessGroup.document: This API is used to delete a permission group.
DeleteAccessGroup.name: Deletes permission group

DeleteAccessRules.document: This API is used to batch delete permission rules.
DeleteAccessRules.name: Batch deletes permission rules

DeleteFileSystem.document: This API is used to delete a file system. Non-empty file systems cannot be deleted.
DeleteFileSystem.name: Deletes file system

DeleteLifeCycleRules.document: This API is used to batch delete lifecycle rules.
DeleteLifeCycleRules.name: Batch deletes lifecycle rules

DeleteMountPoint.document: This API is used to delete a mount point.
DeleteMountPoint.name: Deletes mount point

DescribeAccessGroup.document: This API is used to view the details of a permission group.
DescribeAccessGroup.name: Views permission group details

DescribeAccessGroups.document: This API is used to view the list of permission groups.
DescribeAccessGroups.name: Views permission group list

DescribeAccessRules.document: This API is used to view the list of permission rules by permission group ID.
DescribeAccessRules.name: Views permission rule list

DescribeFileSystem.document: This API is used to view the details of a file system.
DescribeFileSystem.name: Views file system details

DescribeFileSystems.document: This API is used to view the list of file systems.
DescribeFileSystems.name: Views file system list

DescribeLifeCycleRules.document: This API is used to view the list of lifecycle rules by file system ID.
DescribeLifeCycleRules.name: Views lifecycle rule list

DescribeMountPoint.document: This API is used to view the details of a mount point.
DescribeMountPoint.name: Views mount point details

DescribeMountPoints.document: This API is used to view the list of mount points.
DescribeMountPoints.name: Views mount point list

DescribeResourceTags.document: This API is used to view the list of resource tags by file system ID.
DescribeResourceTags.name: Views resource tag list

DescribeRestoreTasks.document: This API is used to view the list of restoration tasks by file system ID.
DescribeRestoreTasks.name: Views restoration task list

DisassociateAccessGroups.document: This API is used to unbind multiple permission groups from a mount point.
DisassociateAccessGroups.name: Unbinds permission group list

ModifyAccessGroup.document: This API is used to modify the attributes of a permission group.
ModifyAccessGroup.name: Modifies permission group attributes

ModifyAccessRules.document: This API is used to batch modify the attributes of permission rules, such as address, access mode, and priority. You must specify the permission rule IDs.
ModifyAccessRules.name: Batch modifies the attributes of permission rules

ModifyFileSystem.document: This API is used to modify the attributes of a successfully created file system.
ModifyFileSystem.name: Modifies file system attributes

ModifyLifeCycleRules.document: This API is used to batch modify the attributes of lifecycle rules, such as name, path, transition list, and status. You must specify the lifecycle rule IDs.
ModifyLifeCycleRules.name: Batch modifies the attributes of lifecycle rules

ModifyMountPoint.document: This API is used to modify the attributes of a mount point.
ModifyMountPoint.name: Modifies mount point attributes

ModifyResourceTags.document: This API is used to modify the list of resource tags by overwriting them all.
ModifyResourceTags.name: Modifies resource tag list

members.document: Permission rule address (IP range or IP)
members.name: Address

members.document: Permission rule access mode (1: read-only; 2: read-write)
members.name: AccessMode

members.document: Priority (value range: 1–100. The smaller the value, the higher the priority)
members.name: Priority

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Permission group description, which is an empty string by default
members.name: Description

members.document: File system capacity (in bytes), which can range from 1 GB to 1 PB and must be an integer multiple of 1 GB
members.name: CapacityQuota

members.document: File system description, which is an empty string by default
members.name: Description

members.document: List of superuser names, which is an empty array by default
members.name: SuperUsers

members.document: Username of the root directory Inode, which is `hadoop` by default
members.name: RootInodeUser

members.document: Group name of the root directory Inode, which is `supergroup` by default
members.name: RootInodeGroup

members.document: Whether to enable verification of Ranger service addresses
members.name: EnableRanger

members.document: List of Ranger service addresses (empty array by default)
members.name: RangerServiceAddresses

Used capacity of the file system, in bytes
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value was found.

members.document:
Used ARCHIVE capacity of COS, in bytes
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ArchiveCapacityUsed

Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

Note: the file system capacity after change cannot be smaller than the currently used capacity

members.document: Restoration task type (`1`: standard; `2`: expedited; `3`: bulk, with only the expedited type available currently)
members.name: Type

members.document: Validity period (in days) of the temporary copy generated during restoration
members.name: Days

members.document: Restoration task status (1: binding file; 2: file binding completed; 3: restoring file; 4: file restoration completed)
members.name: Status

members.document: Transition type (`1`: transition to ARCHIVE; `2`: delete; `3`: transition to STANDARD_IA)
members.name: Type
